intro: Nierembergia hippomanica, commonly known as the golden bellflower, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and has a trailing habit, making it suitable for rock gardens or containers. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, while the stems are hairy and often prostrate. Nierembergia hippomanica thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, blooming from late spring to early autumn.
